unnormalised: ## Cricket Mania and the Chaotic Calendar: A Guide to Deciphering Indian Sports Schedules
normalised: Namaste, fellow cricket enthusiasts! If you're anything like me, you’re constantly juggling work, family, and trying to catch every single match featuring our beloved Men in Blue. But let's be honest, navigating the Indian sports calendar, especially cricket, can feel like trying to solve a particularly fiendish Sudoku. This blog post is dedicated to helping you decode the madness.

normalised: Let's break down some common scheduling conventions. Typically, day-night matches in India start around one thirty P-M or two P-M I-S-T. Test matches usually kick off at nine thirty A-M local time. But be warned, these timings are subject to change depending on weather conditions and broadcasting schedules. Don't rely on just one source; cross-reference multiple sports websites and apps.

normalised: Consider the impact of festivals. Often, major tournaments or series are deliberately scheduled around holidays like Diwali (typically falling in October to November) or Holi (March) to maximize viewership. Be prepared for matches happening even on the festival days themselves!
